reviews.text: Visiting this cinema was the most curious experience. Popcorn is sold in reusable containers that you leave in a tray at the end of the movie. Nobody checks your entry ticket, you just go ahead and sit when a little screen on top of the door tells you to. The rooms are super small so you see the movie with about two dozen people. I just found it lovely.

Been to a movie (Napoleon) in theatre number seven, very small with only about 30 seats or so. For me the second row was too close to the screen, so not that great a view. Thatâ€™s mostly why I give three stars.

Plus is that at least Rex shows the movies (or at least this one) in original languages. As a Dutch guy I despise movies that are shown in German ðŸ˜¬

Furthermore you can see Rex has had better times. Itâ€™s all a bit old and worn down. But for a ticket price of â‚¬7,50 I guess you cannot expect IMAX facilities.
Very nice prices, friendly staff, overall very solid
Nice Theater with decent seats and ticket price. Costs around 9 euros for new movies

The best Cinema in Cologne especially if you are not yet fluent in German or you just prefer to watch the original. I went here a cuple of times and never regret it although the actual screen is a bit smaller then in the bigger cinemas in cologne.
The price is also really good!
